image.altText: Exterior of the Royal Darwin Hospital's emergency and trauma centre.

props.synopsis: The Northern Territory coroner has found "systemic failures" contributed to a woman’s "confronting" death at Royal Darwin Hospital following routine elective surgery on her knee.

title.children: 'Systemic failures' found in woman's post-surgery death at Darwin hospital

image.altText: An area of dead trees and vegetation

props.synopsis: Traditional owners and a scientist fear there have been more fracking fluid spills by gas companies exploring the Northern Territory's Beetaloo Basin.

title.children: 'It killed everything': Scientist assesses fluid spills at NT fracking site

image.altText: A woman standing in front of a microphone at a press conference, outside, with bushland in the background.

props.synopsis: A minimum mandatory prison sentence will be reintroduced for offenders who repeatedly breach a domestic violence order and harm their victim, the Northern Territory government has announced.

title.children: Mandatory sentences for repeat DVO breaches to be reinstated in the NT

image.altText: A man in front of a colourful wall

props.synopsis: A former Alice Springs school principal charged with allegedly assaulting several children has stepped down from town council citing "personal and professional obstacles".

title.children: Former Alice Springs principal resigns from council amid child assault charges

image.altText: Palmerston police station 4

props.synopsis: The teenage girl was held in a Northern Territory police watch house for three nights, with the national children's commissioner calling the incident a "scandalous" reflection of Australia's human rights record.

title.children: Detainment of 15yo in NT police watch house reignites human rights concerns

image.altText: A side-on photo of a man wearing a blue blazer and orange tie. There are blurred out trees in the background.

props.synopsis: One of the Northern Territory's biggest land councils has expressed alarm at the government's planned legislative changes, while pastoralists say the current sacred site laws are a "joke".

title.children: 'A complete joke': Shots fired in battle over changes to NT sacred site laws

image.altText: A man in a basketball jersey in a gym-like workshop, sitting next to a crouching man in yellow jersey both looking at camera

props.synopsis: A one-of-its-kind basketball program in prison gave Aaron Hyde a shot at turning his life around. Now, he's evening the playing field for other young people.

title.children: First Nations-led prison program uses sport to tackle trauma

image.altText: CCTV footage of a store alight

props.synopsis: Successive governments have increased the tax on cigarettes and tobacco to drive down smoking rates — but having helped with one problem, it has contributed to another.

title.children: Smokers have been pushed onto the black market. There's no easy way back

image.altText: An older woman walks down a crowded aisle at a grocery store.

props.synopsis: Research from consumer advocacy group Choice has found the average basket of groceries is now costing Woolworths shoppers more than it was a year ago, while the price has fallen at both Coles and Aldi.

title.children: Choice report finds Woolworths groceries more expensive than a year ago

image.altText: Melbourne International Comedy Festival

props.synopsis: An audience member suffered a medical emergency during the Allstars Supershow at the Palais Theatre in St Kilda.

title.children: Melbourne comedy festival opening stopped due to death in audience

image.altText: A woman types on a laptop computer.

props.synopsis: Nicole hadn't been in her sales job for even a year when she resigned, but her former employer is now trying to stop her working in the same industry for the next six months.

title.children: 'A huge hit to my career': junior worker faces six month non-compete

image.altText: People waiting in line to view a rental property

props.synopsis: More Australian renters believe they may have to rent forever, either by choice or because they are priced out of the market. So what does this mean for "forever renters" in the long term?

title.children: More Australians believe they'll be 'forever renters'. What does it mean?

image.altText: An illustration of a cityscape with two transparent buildings where the athletes village will go.

props.synopsis: Queensland will need tens of thousands of extra construction workers to satisfy the pipeline of infrastructure for the 2032 Olympic and Paralympic Games, expected to heap "enormous pressure" on the sector, building experts say.

title.children: Thousands of construction workers needed for Olympics build

image.altText: Generic child toys

props.synopsis: New analysis reveals just how lucrative Australia's childcare real estate market is while parents face perpetual fee hikes.

title.children: As investors rush to buy up childcare centres, fees are rising sharply

image.altText: Emily Marcocci and her puppy Minnie

props.synopsis: There are five times as many dog attacks in NSW as there were two decades ago and victims are backing an overhaul of legislation after a series of inquiries laid bare potentially life-threatening failures within the system.

title.children: NSW dog ownership laws under review following fatal attacks

image.altText: Assembly worker works on a Chevrolet car

props.synopsis: The Australian share market is poised to fall, after Wall Street and European stocks were hit by the looming threat of tariffs on US car imports. Follow the day's events and insights from our business reporters on the ABC News live markets blog.

title.children: Global stocks fall on fears of Trump auto tariffs

liveBlogKeyEvents.title: Woolworths prices higher than a year ago: Choice
White House expects $US100b annual revenue from car tariffs
The Reject Shop to be bought by Dollarama

image.altText: Jim Chalmers laughing.

props.synopsis: The $5-a-week tax cuts revealed in the federal budget have passed the senate in a late night sitting.

title.children: Surprise tax cuts pass the senate, Coalition vows to repeal them

image.altText: A generic graphic of the NDIS logo surrounded by budget-related paraphenalia.

props.synopsis: The NDIS is getting a lot of negative press at the moment. It’s a far cry from when the scheme first started, writes Evan Young.

title.children: There's another problem facing the NDIS. It's probably not what you think

image.altText: Close up of a collection of jagged red rocks. In the background, two towers spitting flames.

props.synopsis: A prominent environmental lawyer warns that Peter Dutton's pledge to approve a major WA gas project within 30 days of taking office will expose the project to likely legal challenges.

title.children: Dutton's pledge to fast-track North West Shelf could expose it to legal challenge

props.synopsis: Around the clock coverage of news events as they break at home and abroad.

title.children: ABC News Channel live

image.altText: A man takes a photo of a pig's head in a black plastic bag

props.synopsis: Indonesian police launch a preliminary investigation into "acts of terror" against an investigative media organisation after carcasses were delivered to its Jakarta office.

title.children: 'Just cook it': Pig's head, dead rats sent to newsroom in Indonesia

image.altText: Stephen Chappell

props.synopsis: In his first interview since assuming the job last year, Air Marshall Stephen Chappell has warned the country is in a period of strategic volatility as potential military threats grow across the Indo-Pacific, and insists Australia is not overly reliant on the United States.

title.children: Air force chief 'very comfortable' with response to Chinese warships

image.altText: A child with day four measles rash.

props.synopsis: Health departments around the country are warning Australians to be alert for symptoms of measles as concerns grow about a rise in cases amid declining vaccination rates.

title.children: Measles was 'eliminated' 10 years ago. Why have cases started climbing?

image.altText: Close up of an arm being injected with a syringe by a blue-gloved hand

props.synopsis: The administration also plans to scale back efforts to combat malaria, according to documents, but would continue grants for drugs that treat HIV and tuberculosis.

title.children: Trump administration to end funding for child vaccines in poorest nations

image.altText: A red dot is a very ancient galaxy surrounded by much brighter, spiral galaxies.

props.synopsis: A tiny red speck has set a date on an important era in the Universe's early history and given astronomers a surprising insight into the "cosmic dawn".

title.children: Light from an ancient galaxy prompts rethink of Universe's history

image.altText: Close up of four people in surgery scrubs.

props.synopsis: The trial was part of a small — but growing — group of animal-to-human organ transplants, in a practice known as "xenotransplantation".  But will pig livers eventually replace human organ transplants?

title.children: Chinese scientists transplant gene-modified pig liver into human body

image.altText: Mel wearing a white jacket and black top

props.synopsis: Following ABC investigations into claims of widespread bullying, sexism and homophobia, NSW Police has confirmed that a review into its culture is now underway. Those who blew the whistle aren't holding their breath.

title.children: Police whistleblower says she's yet to be contacted ahead of review

image.altText: A young woman touching virtual screen with checkbox lists.

props.synopsis: Artificial intelligence has crept into almost every corner of our lives. So with the federal election looming, BTN High speaks to young people about how they think it will influence voting and how to tell if it's the real deal.

title.children: How to spot AI ahead of the federal election

image.altText: Multiple packets of colourful pharmaceutical medicines.

props.synopsis: The head of one of America's largest pharmaceutical companies says he does not support tariffs on Australian medicines as US President Donald Trump considers more trade restrictions.

title.children: American big pharma boss does not support tariffs on Australian medicines

image.altText: A portrait of Queen Mary of Denmark in a long dress with lace details on the sleeves and a crown.

props.synopsis: Genius move or "cheeky European vacay"? A cost-cutting regional council has narrowly voted to send its mayor and the city band on an expenses-paid trip to entice Queen Mary into a reciprocal visit.

title.children: Struggletown mayor off to Denmark to see the Queen — and lure her home

image.altText: A close up image of the face of a grey and white coloured greyhound dog.

props.synopsis: Forty-two dogs were injured and one euthanased at the venue between July and September 2024. Club officials, trainers, and owners are calling for the "unsuitable" two-turn grass track to be converted to sand.

title.children: Queensland greyhound track remains shut amid safety concerns

image.altText: Tom Green looks on during a GWS game

props.synopsis: Tom Green's teammates will tell you he's a hard player to get off the field. His excuse? He's completely deaf in one ear.

title.children: Completely deaf in one ear, this AFL star can be hard to get off the field

image.altText: Three Kangaroos rugby league celebrate scoring a try

props.synopsis: The Ashes of rugby league will return after a 22-year hiatus, with Australia touring England at the end of the year.

title.children: Rugby league's Ashes returns after 22-year hiatus

image.altText: A storefront with red sale signs inside and a big white sign reading 'Jeanswest'

props.synopsis: Clothing retailer Jeanswest has collapsed, with more than 90 stores set to close within months and hundreds of employees set to lose their jobs.

title.children: Clothing retailer Jeanswest collapses, hundreds of jobs to go
